data.title: Trait ReloadDelay: For Tesla Weaponry are the same.
data.body:
The ReloadDelay: trait for Tesla Structure is the same as Weapons trait but have different meanings which can cause slight confusion.  It should be changed to "ChargeTime:" or "ChargeDelay:" or even "Cooldowntime:" under the Tesla Structures Traits to clear things up.

![screen shot 2017-07-20 at 10 08 08 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14940856/28446553-7eb1bc14-6d99-11e7-8328-756861422eb4.png)

![screen shot 2017-07-20 at 10 08 49 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14940856/28446556-82f78b78-6d99-11e7-9b0a-6e77c1da6a23.png)

data.title: [RA] War Factory quicker production cap and Barracks price increase.
data.body:
Following #13640 

- Barracks: Price $500, up from $400
- War Factory: Production caps at 4 structures (100, 75, 60, 50) instead of 7 (100, 85, 75, 65, 60, 55, 50).

I initially on #13640 to keep away from balance changes that could jeopardize the playtesting of the Hitshape/UnitStance changes but after some deliberations I believe it's worth adding to the playtest a couple more changes from the playtest series.

The barracks price increase isn't really new, was added onto the experimental series and has more or less been anticipated by the playing community and hailed as a step in the right direction. With the UnitStance the Barracks loses an additional role as a damage soaker so I thought of hold of the change but the reward of putting a dent on to the infantry production makes the change worth doing still.

The War Factory cap being the most intriguing change of the two was introduced to the v1.6 playtest series right off the bat as a 'work or die' feature that after hundreds of games ended up as a background feature - meaning it doesn't really add to the game until mid-late game or in big team games. Initially players attempted to take advantage of the 2nd War Factory reducing production time early by 25% in order to execute new aggressive strategies, however quickly faded as the expansion and tech route inevitable dominated it. The super fast tank/vehicle rushes (e.g. 9 second Light Tanks with 4 WF's!) just don't happen. Thus it ended up as a feature I initially hoped for, although less prevalent, as an option later in the game that expands the range of strategies.

In addition to that the $2000 War Factory never really gets to have its production time for its units decreased as its pricing makes additional structures very low priority throughout all matches. This is not the case for all other production queues including building production where the MCV production despite being expensive, is well integrated in the meta and part of just about every strategy. As for the reduction values themselves they're really just the 1st,3rd,5th,7th value of the original 7-steps reduction values for the rest of the production decrease.

data.title: Add a selection priority of 6 to supply trucks
data.body: Otherwise they get selected by the `Select all combat units` key as reported on discord.

data.title: Harvester code cleanup
data.body: Nothing major, but it's another small step towards cleaner code and might give some tiny performance improvements as well.

data.title: Create user map directory if it doesn't exist.
data.body: Fixes #13558.

data.title: Allow mod to be launched after installing required content.
data.body: Closes #13664.

data.title: Unable to load mod after advanced-installing assets.
data.body:
Repro case:
* Remove assets from one of the default mods
* Launch the mod
* Install assets using the "Advanced Install" menu
* Notice that you are forced to quit and restart the game to progress any further.

If all the required content is installed then the "Quit" button should change to "Continue" and launch the mod.

This doesn't need to be a hard blocker for the first playtest, but it should be a simple fix and is definitely needed before the final release.

data.title: Update .deb packaging to allow parallel installations

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body: This should allow the usage of multiple releases and playtests on dpkg based systems simultaneously.

data.title: Game gets unplayably slow when AI can't find route
data.body:
Using `release-20170527`
The game becomes unplayably slow when the AI is unable to find a route.
For example play a 4-player game, you vs 3 AIs, on a map where landmasses are connected by a bridge, then blow up the bridge.

data.title: Unable to type in lobby nor in-game
data.body:
Using openra-20170527, I cannot type anything to chat. Not in the lobby, and not in-game, for neither single nor multiplayer.

```
$ openra
Platform is Linux
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 1920x1080
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 1920x1080
Using window scale 1.00
OpenGL version: 3.0 Mesa 17.1.5
Using default sound device
Internal mods:
        cnc: Tiberian Dawn (release-20170527)
        d2k: Dune 2000 (release-20170527)
        modchooser: Mod Chooser (release-20170527)
        ra: Red Alert (release-20170527)
External mods:
        ra-release-20170527: Red Alert (release-20170527)
Loading mod: ra
libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
```

data.title: Add Documentation On Weapon traits
data.body:
As the title say. there is no way to know what to add or how to use with weapon traits when there is not any documentation on the subject.

They only way atm is to learn from the existing yaml files, but they don't come with a full list of all traits or comments to explain the logic of the traits that are being used.

data.title: Add Documentation On How To Use Conditions
data.body:
We need an extensive tutorial on Conditions for average joes like me, in my case Conditions are really untouchable to the point of being useless for me. 

As the wise man said:
Give a man a fish, and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, and you feed him for a lifetime.

data.title: [RA] Add power-down vision range and reduce general vision of MSilo, IC and Chronosphere
data.body:
The code was missing in #13640

Reduced overall vision of IC, Chrono and Nuke to 6c0 from 10c0 + reduced vision range to 5c0 when powered down.

data.title: Fix funpark01 failing at mission start
data.body: Fixes #13571.

data.title: Revert Yak gun strafing
data.body:
When I filed #13522, I wasn't sure whether the Yak changes would see some acceptance, but since there wasn't much feedback initially, I kept them.

However, with some concerns voiced shortly before it was merged and some shortly after, we're now at @abcdefg30 , @FrameLimiter and @SoScared for voices of (rather strong) concern, so the probability of more complaints and a push to revert it once the playtest is out is extremely high.

In a pre-emptive strike for that, it's probably better to just let it go and drop it before that happens, to save some nerves and time.

The functionality remains, so we can still consider using it for single-player missions at some point, and modders have the option to use it for maps and mods as well, that's good enough.

data.title: Fix ReadWriteZipFile crashing on update.
data.body: Fixes #13634.

data.title: Have a "Load Map" option in the Map Editor-menu
data.body:
Currently when youÂ´re editing a map in the Map Editor and you'd like to open a different map, you have to go back exit the map editor first. You then arrive in the main menu and have to go to map editor again and load a map.

I think it's usefull when Im in the map editor and press menu or [Esc] to also have a "Load Map" option (between the "Save Map" and the "Exit Map Editor" option?).

data.title: Add liblua 5.3 library name so it can build on Fedora Linux
data.body: Lua 5.1 is not available on the current Fedora 25 distribution so I added the Lua 5.3 library file so the compile would work. Only issue I have found with the change is the Red Alert mod will crash with Lua 5.3 but all the other mods are working fine.

data.title: Fire Weapon Based on the number of units in targeted affected cell
data.body: so you have a unit with 2 weapons, a grenade and a rifle, the grenade can do splash damage,so the unit will fire the grenade weapon to hit more targets\units in the same cell or cells(in case of an artillery type unit)  instead of using the rifle to hit 1 target\unit.

data.title: Rework harvester resource claiming
data.body:
This aims to introduce a small island of sanity into the crazy mess of the harvesting code.
Supersedes #13607, fixing the dead-actor and enemy-actor reservation issues.

data.title: Fix crash in SpreadDamageWarhead if range is >= 32c0
Desertbeachtileresort
data.body:
I reorganized the templates for desert beaches, as requested in #13587 .

The excess commits are result of unfortunate accident with notepad++.

data.title: [RA] Adjust AoE damage vs Wood in relation to HitShape Playtest.
data.body:
Adjusts **Artillery**, **Parabomb**, **Cruiser**, **Missile Sub**, **ABomb** and **Nuke Truck** damage vs wood to mimic the current release.

I've spent some time running release and bleed clients side-by-side.

Their damage output is now fairly similar with a few exceptions. It should be much easier to playtest and adjust following these values compared to vanilla.

*Swapped Sub Pen and Naval Yard armor type from Light to Wood.

*Swapped Gap Generator 1000hp Wood armor with 500hp Heavy armor.

data.title: Targetable positions attack access split
data.body:
This is a piece of some refactoring for enter & exit logic. In the future, `Exit` and `Entrances` probably should be merged, but this PR focuses on giving enter activities separate target positions. It does not have much in the way of repositioning access points, but suggestions are welcome and the playtest could be used to tweak it.

In the future I would like to have different kinds of access points (docks for harvesters & aircraft, production exits, and infiltration entrances) and different access/target types for the different kinds of access points.

data.title: Add Support of Types for GivesBuildableArea
data.body:
Fixes #10550.

Also moved GivesBuildableArea to its own file from `Building.cs`

For testcase i made D2K engineer allow placement of walls around him.
